HTMLCollectionNamedItem.summary:
The namedItem() method of the interface returns
the first in the collection whose id or name attribute match the specified name, or null if no element matches.

remarks.para: In JavaScript, instead of calling collection.namedItem("value"), you can also directly access the name on the collection, like collection["value"], unless the name collides with one of the existing HTMLCollection properties.

HTMLCollectionNamedItem.returns: The first in the matching the key, or null if there is none. Always returns null if key is the empty string.
